24. Which of the following is the Linux kernel functionality?

**  
B: This is true. A newly created index is typically compact in physical storage, and logically adjacent entries tend to be physically adjacent as well, which can reduce I/O operations and improve query performance. In contrast, indexes that have been inserted, deleted, and updated for multiple times may become fragmented and deteriorate the performance. Therefore, B is true.

C: This is false. The REINDEX operation (or equivalent index recreating operation) usually requires an exclusive lock (for example, the ACCESS EXCLUSIVE lock in PostgreSQL databases), which means that it blocks other read and write operations on the index during its execution. Although some database systems may offer an option for online index recreation, this does not mean it will not block any operations. It may simply manage locks in a finer-grained manner to minimize the impact on concurrent operations. Therefore, C is false.

D: Deleting and recreating indexes requires exclusive locks on the respective index structures, especially in transactional databases. DROP INDEX needs to delete all data structures related to the index and may require exclusive locks to ensure consistency. Also, CREATE INDEX also requires exclusive locks to re-create the index structure. Therefore, during both operations, read and write operations that attempt to access the index are blocked. This statement is correct.

In conclusion, the answers are A, B, and D.

---

*(No presente na imagem, mas mencionado na concluso como correto)*

This is true. A newly created index is typically compact in physical storage, and logically adjacent entries tend to be physically adjacent as well, which can reduce I/O operations and improve query performance. In contrast, indexes that have been inserted, deleted, and updated for multiple times may become fragmented and deteriorate the performance. Therefore, B is true.

This is false. The REINDEX operation (or equivalent index recreating operation) usually requires an exclusive lock (for example, the ACCESS EXCLUSIVE lock in PostgreSQL databases), which means that it blocks other read and write operations on the index during its execution. Although some database systems may offer an option for online index recreation, this does not mean it will not block any operations. It may simply manage locks in a finer-grained manner to minimize the impact on concurrent operations. Therefore, C is false.

Deleting and recreating indexes requires exclusive locks on the respective index structures, especially in transactional databases. DROP INDEX needs to delete all data structures related to the index and may require exclusive locks to ensure consistency. Also, CREATE INDEX also requires exclusive locks to re-create the index structure. Therefore, during both operations, read and write operations that attempt to access the index are blocked. This statement is correct.

Which of the following descriptions about the Huawei Kunpeng 920 CPU accelerators are true?
Todas as descries (A, B e C) so verdadeiras sobre os aceleradores da CPU Huawei Kunpeng 920.

Motor de acelerao SSL: A CPU possui um motor de acelerao SSL integrado, que permite realizar operaes de criptografia SSL de forma mais rpida e eficiente, otimizando o desempenho de servidores web e aplicaes que utilizam HTTPS.

Motor de acelerao de criptografia/descriptografia: A Kunpeng 920 possui um motor de acelerao dedicado para operaes de criptografia e descriptografia, o que acelera o processamento de dados confidenciais e garante a segurana das informaes.

Motor de acelerao de compresso/descompresso: A CPU tambm possui um motor de acelerao para compresso e descompresso de dados, o que melhora o desempenho de aplicaes que trabalham com grandes volumes de dados, como servidores de arquivos e bancos de dados.
